text: Now that we have a `menu()` function, is it possible to get `blog_comments()` and `{{ blog_comment_form }}` possibly? Being able to customize these elements would also be awesome functionality as right now, you have to CSS everything you want to do.

Good ideas, AJ! These are super locked down concepts right now :crying_cat_face: We a moving towards a world where all default modules use functions, not tags, so developers can see the markup behind default modules, rather than just `{% blog_comments "blog_comments" %}`
Sounds like a plan! Let me know if you ever need beta testers on new functions. Would be happy to help out!
I second what AJ said, always happy to beta test anything new.
`menu` is the first "tougher"/locked down default module we are working through, and we have a few others in the works :speak_no_evil:
you know what would be nice?  a quick edit for pages like wordpress has.  so you can update internal name, title, url etc

:bulb: Provide additional options in the `{{standard_header_includes}}` call to remove some of the items placed in. For example, when doing custom coded templates, we dont need the `<link rel="stylesheet" href="/hs/hsstatic/AsyncSupport/static-1.43/sass/comments_listing_asset.css">` as it makes it harder to overwrite those existing styles. If we had an option in settings to remove those files that would be nice too
